function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reduced outdoor air requirement from 560 m3 to 119 m3 per hour may impact indoor air quality and increase risk of indoor air pollution.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Climate zones variability may impact the effectiveness of the dbaf, leading to varying levels of energy saving potential in different regions.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for indoor air pollution due to reduced outdoor air supply","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to natural ventilation due to reduced outdoor air supply","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different materials used in previous biofiltration system and dbaf may result in different disease transmission and contamination risks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher face velocity in the current dbaf may lead to increased spread of airborne contaminants and pathogens","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Growing concern about energy consumption in buildings may lead to compromises in air quality and disease control measures","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of indoor microbial pollution due to the use of biofiltration system for degradation of formaldehyde and vocs in the air.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient removal of formaldehyde and toluene due to incorrect bed water content levels","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate performance of the botanical filter for both water soluble and insoluble compounds at extreme bed water content levels","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of the wet film in removing formaldehyde from the air due to improper water content","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentrations of formaldehyde and toluene in the built environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in relative humidity due to operation of dbaf","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in air quality due to sustained voc emissions from furniture systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of indoor air with formaldehyde and toluene","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of additional humidity by the air filtration system","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overserving of air filtration for a smaller space","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminant leakage from the chamber or filter system","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate filtration of toluene and formaldehyde due to low bed water content","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Slow decay of emission rate of formaldehyde and toluene","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of filter bed on air temperature and rh","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Maximum clean air provided by the dbaf","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of specific chemicals such as formaldehyde and acetaldehyde in the testing process can pose health risks to individuals.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting the sink effect term in the mass balance equation may result in underestimation of contaminant levels, leading to inadequate mitigation measures.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of single pass efficiency until october 2009","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Chamber leakage rate","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of botanical air filtration system into the hvac system","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No clean air supplied to the chamber","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Chamber leakage effect","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface adsorption effect","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High air change rate and complete air mixing may lead to rapid spread of contagious diseases if present in the chamber","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Injection of vocs volatile organic compounds like formaldehyde and toluene into the chamber for testing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in filter bed moisture content levels during tests may impact the efficiency of vocs removal and air quality","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for microbial growth in the root bed due to the presence of microorganisms and organic compounds","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate moisture control leading to the growth of mold and bacteria in the root bed","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient airflow and ventilation leading to poor air quality and accumulation of vocs in the indoor environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of polluted air into the plant root system","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term performance of the botanical air filtration system","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient data on the effectiveness of botanical air filtration under realistic ventilation conditions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overestimation of indoor plant air purification capabilities based on chamber studies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential microbial growth related to vocs becoming a carbon source for soil microbial communities in plant rhizosphere","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High indoor air pollution levels compared to outdoor levels","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate methods for volatile organic compounds vocs removal from indoor air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of indoor air quality improvement methods","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral clumping and associations with suspended proteins may cause variability in viral particle size.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adenovirus is the most resistant to 254 nm uv-c and requires high uv doses for complete inactivation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on uv inactivation of viral aerosols","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of linear relationship between uv dose and percent survival","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of nebulization and liquid impingement on the survival of animal viruses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of aerosol dryer to ensure uniformity of particles","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"}]}
